node.title: Robinson claims silver in career first Downhill race, stamps mark on speed events
node.description: The Giant Slalom skier is making moves in her first season of new disciplines.
node.content: ["Kiwi Olympic skier Alice Robinson is already stamping her mark on speed events, finishing second at her first ever FIS European Cup Downhill Race in France.", "Robinson, a three-time World Cup champion in technical event Giant Slalom, also recorded a career-best Super-G finish in December last year - claiming fourth at the St Mortiz Super-G World Cup.", "Now the 20-year-old is making herself known in the other speed event.", "Racing as the final competitor in her first Downhill race, Robinson came from behind to complete a superb run time of 1:24:78, clocking in just +0.33 behind Switzerland's Juliana Suter.\u00a0", "\u201cIt was really fun, it\u2019s a great slope,\" says Robinson. \"It\u2019s a Europa Cup race so it\u2019s a great level. I had some really good sections and there were some spots that I can improve on, so it was a really solid result for my first Downhill race.\u201d\u00a0\u00a0", "Robinson's hoping to lower her Downhill FIS points, as she works towards securing entry into Downhill training days prior to Super-G World Cups.\u00a0", "The training days occur on the same slope of each World Cup Super-G race, helping her gain an advantage her competitors already have - familiarisation of the slopes.", "Robinson says her game plan is working.", "\"The goal today was to ski solid and get a decent result so I can get under 80 FIS points. I just wanted to ski really solid and execute the plan, so I am happy.\u201d\u00a0", "Robinson is back in action tonight at the second FIS European Cup Downhill."]
